entry.title: Payback's A Bitch
entry.summary:
Author: GPTwrites (craaazyaboutMalfoy)

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 840Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 26

Summary: I stumbled across an old tumblr prompt and it just wouldn't leave me alone, so here we are. Prompt:wheres the fic where Clark Kent gets caught kissing Batman, and then gets hounded by the media every waking moment because “average civilian is dating Batman!!” and Clarks mourning the loss of his anonymity, meanwhile Bruce thinks its fucking hilarious, enjoy dealing w the press in both of your alter egos now, pretty boy, so Clark waits several months for the whole thing to die down before showing up as Superman to some party Bruce is attending and flying up to Bruce and going “paybacks a bitch” and just full on makes out with him in front of like a million reporters.

entry.title: Your Love is Sunlight
entry.summary:
Author: Floof_likes_fluff

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,443Chapters: 3/6Kudos: 34

Summary: Clark has been dating Bruce, millionaire playboy for the past 2 years but he slowly can't take feeling like Bruce's side piece. He knows Bruce loves him, but their relationship can't go on if Bruce even refuses to call what they have a relationship. So, they break up. Or well, they would if they were in a romantic relationship and not "friends". Years later and the two have moved on, or have they really? After some misunderstandings and some fights, Superman and Batman have developed a type of friendship, or well at least an appreciation. Together, they formed the Justice League and while not often, from time to time, they are on monitoring duty together at the Watchtower. While neither of them would admit it, the Man of Steel and the Shadow of Gotham start developing feelings for each other (or maybe they just never let go of their previous love)

entry.title: Bruce’s silly self
entry.summary:
Author: Silly_Ody

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,093Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 18

Summary: “Oh, B. it’s not your fault. It’s not, don’t say that.” Clark rubbed his hand against Bruce’s back, using his other hand to whisk through Bruce’s neatly combed hair, messing it up. Bruce pathetically looked up at him, his eyeliner and mascara smeared, running down his face. “Wipe those tears, m’kay?” He slid his hand out from Bruce’s hair and to his face, cleaning the black stains.“All he wanted, B, was sex and fame. You couldn’t control that, it is not your fault.” Firm eyes stared into his, repeating it one more time.“Not your fault.”Or-Bruce thinks he’s finally got it, he’s finally made a good relationship, and intends to keep it, despite the other members of the batfam thinking he can’t., or just that the relationship isn’t going to end good. in the end, they were right, it all explodes in his face in public at a gala, what was supposed to be a happy call turned into an absolutely devastating break up over call. After, Bruce convinced this time really was all his fault, Clark helps him to get out of his saddened state and then the Batfam pull elaborate plots to help Bruce and Clark end up together. (Because the two stupidly in love idiots think one is not in love with the other.)

entry.title: Through blue lens
entry.summary:
Author: wwlynx

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,975Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: The most vulnerable he has ever been, was kept reserved sacred for Clark’s iris- and Clark’s only. Gentle honest eyes, easy apologies and a wry smile that held the world. Perhaps was how loving he was- easy smiles and shiny eyes. Soft spoken words. Gentle touches- mere pats on the shoulders, shared glances. Bruce couldn’t stop. Couldn’t place. Couldn’t control. Bruce Wayne was a selfish bastard wishing, wanting, desiring and hoping.Clark Kent was kind, loyal and saw a friend in him- Clark who saw beyond the man in the mask, beyond Wayne.

entry.title: Project Kent
entry.summary:
Author: moonrose8456

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,481Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 23

Summary: When cold, isolated and bitter Batman is forced to work with local Kryptonian and Metropolis heart-throb Superman, he's determined to unmask him. How could he possibly be expected to work with someone he didn't even know? With a master plan to seduce journalist Clark Kent in an attempt to find the hero's identity, Bruce Wayne is determined to get to know the man beyond the costume.But as time goes on, Bruce becomes conflicted. When real feelings begin to envelope his plan for both Superman and Clark, the line between morality and insanity begins to blur. Who is Superman? Why does this reporter know him so well? And why do they both have ridiculously gorgeous black hair?

entry.title: The Memory Between Us
entry.summary:
Author: brmqtr

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,103Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 21

Summary: When a meta-human’s psychic attack sweeps across Gotham, Bruce Wayne wakes up with a perfect mind and one impossible gap — he’s forgotten Clark Kent. Clark returns to Gotham as a stranger, watching the man he loves move through their shared routines like a ghost who doesn’t know he’s haunting himself. Over late-night chess, rooftop patrols, and the quiet rituals of tea instead of coffee, something stirs — a recognition deeper than memory. But when the case brings them back to Crime Alley, and the floodgates of memory finally break open, Bruce must face the truth that even amnesia couldn’t erase: he may forget the name, but never the man. Because some things — a heartbeat, a hand, a look — are too deeply known to ever be forgotten.

entry.title: Power
entry.summary:
Author: ope-uh-oh (shortjacketlongskirt)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 27,071Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 122

Summary: “Oh, you do like to flirt, don’t you?” Lex accused almost playfully, if not for the sharklike emptiness in his eyes.Bruce sat back as the appetizer plates were taken away and replaced with the entrée: filet mignon in a mushroom gravy, served with truffles, asparagus, and black garlic potatoes. He couldn’t help but think Clark would have appreciated this. And he desperately wished he was here with him rather than Vicki.He flashed a playful grin at Lex. “Flirting is what makes the world go round, Lex. What is that quote attributed to Oscar Wilde? ‘Everything in the world is about sex except sex, which is about power’. It applies to everything. Make people think you want them, and you’ve got the whole world in your hands.”After years of living in the closet, trying to ignore the truth, Bruce is finally cornered and is forced to come out in a very public way. This leads to a series of challenges, blending his public and private life in way he can’t escape.
